New Records: Tanzim Hasan's career-best figures of 3 for 18 in four overs
Klaasen-Miller set NY partnership record of 79
Key Match Events: Keshav Maharaj defended 10 runs in the last over to secure a 4-run win for South Africa
Aiden Markram took a stunning running catch at long-on to deny Bangladesh a famous win
Tanzid Hasan dropped Mahmudullah at slip, which could have changed the game
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa chose to bat first on a used wicket, despite chasing being the way to win matches in New York
Bangladesh had one change in their team, with Tanzid Hassan replacing Soumya Sarkar
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa won their third consecutive match in the tournament, and will head to the Caribbean already into the Super8s
Bangladesh still have Nepal and Netherlands to play, and will look to go through to the Super 8 Round
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd at Eisenhower Park was a sea of green, with Bangladesh fans turning out in large numbers
South Africa's top three have struggled at the tournament this far, with just 61 runs collectively in nine trips to the crease
